definitions.definition: something that is added to something else in order to improve it or complete it; something extra:
examples: The doctor said she should be taking vitamin supplements.

definitions.definition: a part of a magazine or newspaper, either produced separately or as part of the magazine or newspaper:
examples: The newspaper publishes a sports supplement every Monday.

definitions.definition: an extra part of a book, either produced separately or included at the end of the book, containing information that was not available when the book was first published:
examples: There is a supplement to the dictionary containing new words.

definitions.definition: to add something to something to make it larger or better:
examples: He supplements (= adds to) his income by working in a bar at night.
